_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION/EMERGENCY RESPONSE AT NORTHERN AG SERVICE, INC., 105 ARMOUR ST,   WEST UNION, IA

Northern Ag Sevice, Inc. complies with ANSI Standards for Anhydrous Ammonia storage.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and local regulations.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to immediately notify the local Fire Department ( a 911 call ) and request a response to the emergency.  A follow up call will be made to the office of the County LEPC.  A real emergency will be unexpected and may be very different in nature from any training in the past.  However, any previous planning/training will serve as guidelines to follow.

The primary emergency coordinator is Randy Osmundson.  His work and 24 hr. Emergency  number is listed in the Registration Section of this document.  Additional contacts are listed below in order:

    Randy Osmundson, owner
     Work: (563) 422-6281   24 hr. (563) 880-8030

    Chris Gefaller, operations
      Work: (563) 422-6281   24 hr. (563) 880-8022

    Scott Peterson, agronomy
      Work: (563) 422-6281   24 hr: (563) 880-8020

DESCRIPTION OF THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE/DISTRIBUTION PLANT AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED AT NORTHERN AG SERVICE, INC., WEST UNION, IA.

This facility is a bulk anhydrous ammonia storage and distribution plant.  The anhydrous ammonia that is stored at this facility is distributed  to agricultural crop producers in the surrounding area who utilize the anhydrous ammonia for crop nutrient purposes.

The system consists of (1) 30,000 gallon storage tank with associated piping, valves, etc., as well as several portable tank units.  The anhydrous ammonia plant is operated on a seasonal basis (Spring and Fall).

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:

This facility complies with EPA, State, and local codes and regulations.  The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with ANSI St

andards and State law.

In addition, the company has specific operating procedures in place intended to minimize the potential for an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

Northern Ag Service, Inc., West Union, IA, has not experienced accidental release involving anhydrous ammonia in the last 5 years that caused death, injuries, evacuations, property or environmental damage.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous  ammoia system, it is the policy of Northern Ag Service, Inc., to immediately contact the local Emergency Responders (fire dept., local police, county LEPC) with a 911 call.  Members of the local fire and police departments are encouraged to become familiar with our location and facilities, enabling them to more quickly asses any necessary response procedures.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

Our overall plan is to minimize hazards to human health and to the environment that are associated with accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  Employees working with the anhydrous ammonia system make routine observations and inspections prior to and during transfer operations of the anhydrous ammonia from the storage tank to nurse tanks, enabling them to detect problems early before they can cause a hazardous situation.  Empoyees are trained annually to recognize areas of potential hazards and new hires are trained immediately and observed to determine their level of cmprehension and understanding.  The company makes every effort to cooperated with local, state, and federal officials as they endeavor to assist us with our anhydrous ammonia operation.
